content.description:
The old school classic on what used be Outhouse Slab (RIP the old, nasty outhouse at the parking lot on the left side of the formation).

Start up below the middle of the overlap eyebrow feature.  Traverse left to an easy up.  Clip bolt, easier climbing to the top.
content.protection: Some bolts and a mid anchor on the slab.  Trad rack.
content.location: Just right of the middle of Suncup Slab.  Kinda follows right leaning features at the bottom.

content.description: We started on a flake, that is maybe 5.6, then the slab climbing above is fun and easy to a two bolt anchor. Just to the left, is an ancient 1/4" bolt. Pitch two, is straight friction slab climbing. You can walk off, or, below the top is a knob where a gear anchor can be built to bring up a second.
content.protection: No anchors except the two newer and one ancient one, right in the middle of the slab (top of pitch one). Not much of anyplace useful to put pro en route either, so you are on your own getting a rope up top. If someone in your group can manage that, though, it is fun and easy climbing on top rope, even for beginners.
content.location: Ascend the crack formed by a flake at the bottom, then head for the two bolt anchor. Pitch two, head up to the knob to build an anchor for a second, or head for the top.
